DAZ Script Documentation DAZ Studio SDK License

DAZ Studio's built-in scripting language is known as DAZ Script. It is a dynamically typed, interpreted, object-oriented language based on QtScript, which itself is based on a subset of the ECMAScript Standard (ECMA-262). See the Scripting Documentation for information on using DAZ Script to access and/or control DAZ Studio. For information on making your plugin scriptable, see the included documentaion.

  • End User License Agreement
  • DAZ Studio SDK and the LGPL
OpenGL Documentation Qt® Documentation

DAZ Studio uses OpenGL for all drawing/rendering done in the interactive viewport. Developers who are writing plugins which need to do custom drawing in the 3D viewports must use the OpenGL API. The dzopengl.h header has been provided for developers to make their code easily portable between the platforms supported by DAZ Studio, developers should always include this file rather than including the platform specific OpenGL headers to ensure that their code can be ported to other platforms.

The following links are provided for more information about the OpenGL Specification:

  • OpenGL.org: the OpenGL homepage, provides Documentation, Coding Resources, and the online OpenGL community.
  • OpenGL Extension Registry: maintains a list of ARB approved OpenGL extensions, as well as vendor-specific extensions to OpenGL.

The DAZ Studio core classes and SDK rely heavily on the Qt library, it is highly recommended that DAZ Studio developers are familiar with Qt.

The links below are provided to access the Digia® Online Documentation for Qt:

  • Qt 4.8 Documentation
  • Qt homepage
  • Qt Documentation site
